name: InterContinental Bucharest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We celebrated our wedding at that hotel and spent 3 days in one of their Junior Suits. It was great. Rooms are very nice. Ask for a room on an upper floor to get a great view.
reviews.title: Best View in Town

reviews.text: Food is very good. Price-wise i think it is a good deal.
reviews.title: Once the best in Bucharest

reviews.text: Very good location, close to the old city (were all the night-life is)
reviews.title: Launchpad for the Land of Dracula
Classy hotel for an affordable price
reviews.text: Good hotel, once the best in Bucharest. It is a bit overrated.I had a bad experience when I was to spend the night on a Saturday, January 19, this year.All night the music sounded all rooms.The restaurant was a wedding with live music.Incredibly for a hotel that is respected.

I stayed in this property in the March 2013 period. It is located in downtown and all in all it is a great deal for the price and meets all aspects of a InterContinental property. It is right next to the metro and there were always a handful of taxies out front.
reviews.title: Great hotel
dated
reviews.text: we did not stay here but we went for a coffee break during our walking tour around bucharest.
the hotel needs refurbishment badly.everything looked in good condition but the style is from the '80's.the service, politness and profesionalism of the cafe employers were excellent though.
reviews.title: Very good hotel in an excellent location

reviews.text: This was my second stay at the hotel and each time I found the staff very helpful, the rooms comfortable and the food very good. It is close to the metro, shopping and best of all to a historic, very charming area of Bucharest with many restaurants, boutiques and beautiful builidngs that escaped demollition by the communist regime and are now being restored to their former glory. I would definitely stay in the hotel again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but old facilities

reviews.text: Stayed two nights there. The room was big but the facilities were a kind of old. The staff came twice to my room the fix the electricity console and air-conditioning. Nevertheless, Staff were friendly and the hotel is walking distance from the old town.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: We have been to many conference hotels and this is the best by far. Staff could not be more attentive. Everything is impeccable. The beds are marvelous and I've slept really well. Our conference was superb and the staff took good car of us.
reviews.title: Consistently excellent

reviews.text: Stayed at this Hotel during busines travel 5 nights in May. Built ~40 years ago the hotel is very well maintained. However the hotel keeps the style of those years. Excellent location in the middle of the city with wonderfull view. Close to many theatres, and the re-vamped "old city". Excelent attention from the very helpfull personnel; breakfat good includes local food on top of normal Intercontinental menu, but without variation (same each day). On the down side they don't have a bussiness centre (just the few computers with printers and internet access).
reviews.title: Business Travel

reviews.text: Well.. not totaly for free of course, but almost.. if u calculate what u get per euro (or lei). The hotel was built in the 70' and that fact makes it one of the newest in Bucharest. It has a great view from upper floors and its location is the best: above University square, National Theater, metro station and Nicolae Bulevard. A max 10 minutes of walking is sufficient to get you to Unirii mall or, if you want, to the huge Parliament Palace. The hotel itself is superb: rooms are rather big, warm (You wont feel the very cold weather outside) and stylishly decorated. Beds are comfy, bath rooms are exactly what you expect from that kind of hotel. Breakfasts are delicious and varied. You can find almost all the information you need to know about touring the city in the reception.
reviews.title: luxury for free

reviews.text: Inter is considerd expensive in Bucharest, but you won't find such in Western Europe. Not in this price however.
reviews.title: great private lounge

reviews.text: We stayed on a business floor. The rooms are big, cozy and as written, a little dated in style
reviews.title: Get accosted just outside the lobby

reviews.text: The hotel is spotlessly clean. They clean the room several times a day.
reviews.title: The Best Staff Team

reviews.text: Went to Bucharest on business after 17 years, with accomodation booked by our travel agent.
reviews.title: Better than expected

likes.disliked: — there's room for improvement for a 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Intercontinental was in the middle of Bucharest. Lovely service, clean and friendly. Loved the rooms, we had at least 10 comfy pillows on our bed. Continental breakfast was great and enjoyed it.
reviews.title: LOVED IT!

reviews.text: we stayed in the hotel during the last weekend. the flight arrived in the middle of the night, the hotel staff offered breakfast for 25ERO per person and told us that everything is closed outside. it was not true, we went for a walk and eat for 5 ERO all of us.when we came back the reception staff didnt gave us the room although it was ready. the were asking for 40 ERO per night for breakfast and the WiFi. only to be able to get the room 4 hours before STD check in. when we thought about it the manager from the reception canceled the offer. we felt like they were trying to hasseled us. bad feeling for such an expensive hotel.
reviews.title: terrible staff

reviews.text: In the recent years Bucharest has seen the opening of more fancy and/or more luxurious hotels than the INTERCONTINENTAL. But the INTER -. which was the first 5 star in town some decades ago - still remains my favourite. The wellness center on 22nd floor as well as the Club Lounge on 21st floor offer spectacular views of Bucharest.
reviews.title: Classic 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent price/quality ratio.
reviews.title: Well appointed stay in Bucharest

reviews.text: The Intercontinental offers all of the standard expectations for a higher level, business type of hotel. Rooms are well appointed. The beds are comfortable and the views are probably one of the best in Bucharest. Although the air conditioning can be controlled in the room, the lowest temperature that can be set is 18C. We prefer the room to be cooler at night and especially after sightseeing on a warm day.
reviews.title: Not up to InterContinental standards

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel very highly. Although the rooms I have seen were a bit dated, some refurbishment has been carried out in the public areas. I was in Bucharest for an international meeting and unfortunately was only there for two days, so wasnt able to explore the city. However, the hotel is really well placed, close to the old town and, the university, the national theatre and many restaurants. The food served in the hotel restaurants was very good, with an excellent breakfast buffet, which included a wide selection for continental breakfast, and all the cooked food one would normally expect. The lunch buffet is also very good and highly recommended and the restaurant itself is very nicely decorated and light.
reviews.title: Very good comfortable hotel in the centre of the city

reviews.text: My room was on 16th floor and I was delighted that itnot only had windows which opened - a real rarity in hotels these days, it also had a balcony and a great view over the city - a real treat. The bathroom was clean and the shower worked beautifully. My only minor complaint about the room was that although I managed to turn off the very powerful airconditioning on the first night when I returned to the room on the second, the a/c had been turned back on and I couldnt turn it off again, so I was absolutely freezing, despite the lovely weather outside.
reviews.title: Great comfortable Hotel near old town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received excellent service in the hotel and I cant speak highly enough of the staff. I should say that one of my colleagues is blind and was accompanied by a guide dog, and the staff were extremely helpful with regard to his particular needs, so I would particularly recommend the hotel for people with disabilities or others who need particular assistance.
reviews.title: Good choice in central Bucharest

reviews.text: I would also add that there is a bus from the airport which stops only a few minutes walk from the hotel, and I would recommend this to anyone anxious about being ripped off by Bucharest's taxi drivers. Although I was picked up at the airport on arrival, I took the bus back when I left and it was great (the journey takes about an hour)
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Unfortunately I didnt get time during my stay to try the pool and spa area.
reviews.title: Ideally situated

reviews.text: I was very pleasantly surprised as a recent review stated the hotel was worn out,this is utter rubbish,it is adjacent to a new building under final construction and stands quite proudly and looks damn good with national flags and waterfall at the entrance.I arrived to a full house and even as a Royal Ambassador member was unable to get my usual upgrade to a suite but staff were quick to make sure the moment one became vacant,they would transfer me and I was.............The hotel has a pleasant seating area in the lobby and a lively bar,in addition a bright and airy coffee shop with panoramic views were I had an excellent lunch with a fine bottle of local wine. All of their staff speak excellent English, it was very easy to communicate with everybody,and the menu was a delight to read through. Pork seems to be the national dish and is offered in a variety of delicious entrées I had a grilled pork chop,including a wonderful dish of roasted potatoes cooked with bacon with onions shallots and spices it was absolutely delicious. Having had a chance to experience more than one type of room I can say with the certainty that the rooms themselves are beautifully appointed with plush carpets following a very distinct and early European style which is typically associated with this area of the world. The Club lounge is located on the 21st floor it is also beautifully appointed their staff look after you from the moment you arrive until the moment that you leave there is abundant choices for breakfast, snacks at lunch Definitely multiple-choices of wonderful snacks with evening cocktails. The Sunday brunch starting at midday continued with a fabulous selection of entrées throughout the time it was open not once did the chef allow any of the food to get cold and made sure that the supply was abundant. My judgment for the stay of more than four days was it has an excellent location, the hotel is beautifully appointed throughout, their staff are extremely friendly and helpful this for me is what staying in a Eastern European country is all about,home away from home............. They make you welcome,its a great place to stay so try it yourself with confidence........
reviews.title: Excellent from check in to departure............and excellent value.

reviews.text: I used this hotel for one night for business. The staff were extremely friendly, my room (1020) was lovely and clean, also comfortable. Hotel very large. The only thing that knocks the rating down one was Wifi very expensive, 16 euros for 24 hours, also food very expensive. One other comment, outside of the Hotel's control is that I got approached a lot from pimps outside trying to sell me prostitutes
reviews.title: Wonderful Staff

reviews.text: I usually stay in the Radisson but for some reason this week it was £200 a night so I decided to keep the costs down and stay at the Intercontinental.
reviews.title: A tired and smoky hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is a bit worn out and could do with a face lift. Romania is a smokers country which means groups of people smoking in all public areas. The bar area is very old fashioned and the service dowdy.
reviews.title: reasonable location at the affordable price

reviews.text: The rooms are old fashioned and mine had dirt in the bath. In addition to that there was no complimentary water and my half eaten apple remained on the tray for the 2 days I was there.
reviews.title: this is a smokers hotel

reviews.text: Outstanding hotel, good staff and a great all round experience, outstanding value per night, a premier weekend location,particulary as so convenient to old town night life, definitely recommend all weekend visitors to Bucharest stay here.
reviews.title: Great Experience, Great Location, I Will defintely be returning, especially for weekend stays

reviews.text: Booked airport transfer for 35euro as flight arriving 8pm onwards, maybe somewhat overpriced compared to yellow meter taxi's. but OTP airport is supposedly rife with taxi fiddles so IC Mercedes transfer is a worthwhile investment.
reviews.title: Great hotel for bikers

reviews.text: 9pm Friday xfer took only 25 minutes However return to airport using a metered taxi will be only about 15euro.
reviews.title: Top concierge service

reviews.text: Bed, pillows nice and comfy, I slept well, two bathrooms, one with jacuzzi, the other a walkin shower. Instant copious hot water when needed.
reviews.title: Cool place in the heart of Romania

reviews.text: Aircon worked well, not overly noisy. Furnishings all good,no signs of wear at all, top marks all round
reviews.title: Business w/e in Bucharest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are two things good about this hotel and they are: The Avis car rental and the concierge. This hotel needs work for it to be a five star. The carpeting is ripped on the staircase, the rooms have TV's from the 1980's, the carpet in the ballroom looks like dirt, it is noisy, and we are platinum plus members of this hotel group (the highest that anyone can be) and we did not get an upgrade to a suite. We have traveled all over the world and always had an upgrade. I know it is upon availability and the reception said there were suites available, but didn't upgrade us. I didn't argue and just stayed at Radisson Blu for my next night in Bucharest. Radisson Blu gave us a free upgrade and I joined their point system.
reviews.title: not a five star as advertised.

reviews.text: Great location...clean...nice breakfast...helpful staff....
reviews.title: Stay

reviews.text: Intercontinental is superbly located in the heart of the city, practically atop a Metro stop, and two blocks from Lipscani, easily the most charming part of the city (and filled with cafes and great for strolling) and shops and cafes along Victory Street (Calea Victoriei). It is also close to a stop on the Bucharest City Tour (a Hop On and Hop Off tour). Very comfortable rooms and an excellent breakfast buffet. Definitely enjoy the croissants. These are the real, buttery pastry that is nothing like the pallid version served in the US. And, grab one with chocolate and you'll be eating a bite of heaven. There's lots to see in the city. http://www.offbeattravel.com/bucharest-romania-landmarks-attractions.html
reviews.title: Superbly located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we tried both restaurants and the food was very good.
reviews.title: very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: spa/pool on 22nd floor is a flashback to the 1970's and needs to be seen.
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Location

description: Towering above the city skyline, InterContinental Bucharest is one of the city's favourite international high-rise hotels, a distinction owed to its ideal location, fine appointments and impeccable service. Experience the Club InterContinental Lounge on the 21st floor of the hotel for a memorable stay in a relaxing, private and elegant setting designed to fulfil the expectations of the business travellers. Immerse yourself in the beautifully designed pool, with panoramic city vistas on the 22nd floor. Dine at Corso Brasserie, offering a contemporary Romanian menu and glass walls overlooking Bucharest. For a fine dining experience, try the Modigliani Pasta e Carne, one of the top Italian restaurants in Bucharest.The Old City Center, the Romanian Athenaeum Concert Hall and Cismigiu Gardens are just a few minutes away from the hotel. You’re also within walking distance of Bucharest’s business and shopping districts. Start your Bucharest's itinerary with the amazing city view from your room balcony!
